it.dc.bridge.om

Class AJObjectManagerApp

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.dc.bridge.om.AJObjectManagerApp
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class AJObjectManagerApp
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    AJObjectManager is the AllJoyn class that provides the CoAP resources to the AJ network. It takes new resource registrations and registers AJ objects representing that resources.

    The class also deals with the method calls: it receives calls from the AllJoyn network and then sends the method call as a CoapRequest to the CoAP Server.

        Creates a new AllJoyn CoAPResource and registers it to the AllJoyn Bus.
        Parameters:

        resourceType - the resource type (can be null)
        interfaceDescription - the interface description (can be null)
        endpointName - the endpoint name

        public void removeResource(java.lang.String objectPath)

        Parameters:

      • callMethod

        public ResponseMessage callMethod(java.lang.String path,
                                  CoAP.RequestCode code,
                                  CoAPRequestMessage request)
        Send the method call to the CoAP Proxy. The request message to be sent to the Proxy is the Californium Request. So, the method creates the Request starting from a message implementing the CoAPRequestMessage interface. The method call response from the Proxy is a Californium Response. This method translates the response message into a CoAPResponseMessage.
        Parameters:
        path - the URI path
        code - the request code
        request - a message implementing the request interface
        Returns:
        the response message

      • register

        public org.alljoyn.bus.Status register(java.lang.String uniqueName,
                                       java.lang.String objectPath,
                                       CoAPRequestMessage request)
        Sends to the CoAPProxy a request in order to receive future notifications from that resource.
        Parameters:
        uniqueName - the client unique name
        objectPath - the object path of the observable resource
        request - the request message
        Returns:
        status code

      • cancel

        public void cancel(java.lang.String uniqueName,
                   java.lang.String objectPath)
        Informs the CoAPProxy to stop receiving notifications.
        Parameters:
        uniqueName - the client unique name
        objectPath - the object path

      • notify

        public void notify(java.lang.String objectPath,
                   org.eclipse.californium.core.coap.Response coapMessage)
        Sends a notification for the specific object to the AllJoyn network. The method receives a CoAP message, translates it into a ResponseMessage and sends this one as an AllJoyn signal.

        If a client wants to receive notifications, after it calls the #registration(String) method, it must add the match rule: addMatch(rule), where rule is a string following the DBus specification. The rule has to specify three fields:

        • interface: com.bridge.Coap
        • path: the object path of the resource it registered
        If the rule is not added or not all the three fields are correctly set the client will not receive notifications.
        Parameters:
        objectPath - the object path
        coapMessage - the CoAP message to notify

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the AllJoyn Object Manager application. The method does the follow:
        • Connects the Object Manager to the AllJoyn Bus
        • Requests and advertises a well known name
        • Binds the session port

      • run

        public void run()
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
